It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, violet-blue petals that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to the cold, arid conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Chiropetalum boliviense is considered a vulnerable species.
